thread.title: U.S. officials battling election misinformation and foreign interference

title: U.S. officials battling election misinformation and foreign interference
text: Live Streaming 24/7 Latest Videos [ 1:23 ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/lawsuit-filed-against-u-s-mcdonalds-over-e-coli-outbreak/) [ Lawsuit filed against U.S. McDonald’s over E. coli outbreak ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/lawsuit-filed-against-u-s-mcdonalds-over-e-coli-outbreak/) The first lawsuit has been filed against McDonald’s over an E. coli outbreak that’s been linked to at least one death and dozens of illnesses across America. Michael Yoshida looks at the growing legal trouble for the fast food giant. 7m ago [ 1:40 ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/u-s-officials-battling-election-misinformation-and-foreign-interference/) [ U.S. officials battling election misinformation and foreign interference ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/u-s-officials-battling-election-misinformation-and-foreign-interference/) With less than two weeks to go until election day, American officials are battling misinformation — and this time, it’s not coming from the candidates. Brian Abel looks at the steps being taken to prevent foreign interference. 10m ago Most Popular Videos [ 3:51 ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/four-dead-woman-rescued-following-fiery-ev-crash-in-toronto/) [ Four dead, woman rescued following fiery EV crash in Toronto ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/four-dead-woman-rescued-following-fiery-ev-crash-in-toronto/) Four people are dead, and a woman suffered serious injuries following a single-vehicle crash in downtown Toronto. The electric vehicle burst into flames as a result of the impact, and the woman was pulled from the burning car by bystanders. 6h ago [ 1:55 ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/23/ontario-educators-wearing-protective-gear-for-protection-from-violence/) [ Ontario educators wearing protective gear for protection from violence ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/23/ontario-educators-wearing-protective-gear-for-protection-from-violence/) The Ford government is being called on to provide more supports for education workers experiencing school violence. Education Minister Jill Dunlop says funding being provided to school boards isn’t being used. Mark McAllister reports. 22h ago Local Videos National Videos World Videos [ 1:23 ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/lawsuit-filed-against-u-s-mcdonalds-over-e-coli-outbreak/) [ Lawsuit filed against U.S. McDonald’s over E. coli outbreak ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/lawsuit-filed-against-u-s-mcdonalds-over-e-coli-outbreak/) The first lawsuit has been filed against McDonald’s over an E. coli outbreak that’s been linked to at least one death and dozens of illnesses across America. Michael Yoshida looks at the growing legal trouble for the fast food giant. 7m ago [ 1:40 ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/u-s-officials-battling-election-misinformation-and-foreign-interference/) [ U.S. officials battling election misinformation and foreign interference ](https://toronto.citynews.ca/video/2024/10/24/u-s-officials-battling-election-misinformation-and-foreign-interference/) With less than two weeks to go until election day, American officials are battling misinformation — and this time, it’s not coming from the candidates. Brian Abel looks at the steps being taken to prevent foreign interference. 10m ago
